intro: Aidia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf aidia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, ranging from elliptical to ovate, and its showy, pink to purple flowers. It typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as prairies and wetlands. Aidia heterophylla is often found in clay soils and is adapted to wetland environments.
